content.title: TOS Definition
content.definition: Thoracic outlet syndrome is compression of neurovascular structures (brachial plexus, subclavian vessels) in the thoracic outlet.
content.statement: TOS Definition is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Thoracic-Outlet-Syndrome that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding TOS Definition helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of TOS Definition include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of TOS Definition.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
